I like this bakery because it's at least 10% cheaper than Sheng Kee nearby and their pastries are fresh and piping hot.  You grab a tray and self serve. There are some combos - look up the wall in back of the cashier. You can get 2 buns and a hot coffee or milk tea for $3-4. 

If you buy a loaf of bread, you can also ask them to slice it for you, Free of charge
author: Jannie Q.

description:
I'm a total sucker for sweets and when Pineapple King decided to emerge on Irving, I wasn't overly interested until I saw the reviews and saw people mention that they have a cross between a pineapple bun and a cream puff. Okay, I'm listening... 

Pineapple King does deal a lot with pineapple buns. They can put cold butter in it, put ice cream, add cream in the middle, make a strawberry cream pineapple bun puff, and even put BBQ pork in it. It's ridiculous how much they can actually do with a pineapple bun. 

The one thing I love about Chinese bakeries is that you can buy like 5 items for less than $5. It's insane how cheap their items are. And they're amazing, too! I don't wanna join the hype, but you really have to get their pineapple puffs when you're here. It's the bomb.  

Service isn't overly friendly but they are speedy and will get you in and out fast. 

Parking is a bit of a hassle cos they're located on Irving St. and it's metered till 6pm so good luck!
author: Venus L.

description: Delicious! We tried the famous warm pineapple bread with a slice of cold butter the first time. Unique and really tasty! The next night we tried a strawberry shortcake slice. This one was really, really tasty. Light, moist, and fresh. If you're looking for something sweet and small to complement a meal, we highly recommend Pineapple King!
author: Bryce B.

description: Better customer service comparing to Sheng Kee with a different bread selection in here. The bread sizes are smaller, cheaper but they're unique and worth the try!
author: Sarah P.

description: I'm not exactly sure why, but I have grown to prefer Pineapple King over Sheng Kee.  Sheng Kee definitely has more variety, but I think Pineapple King might be fresher (or if not, they do a good job of maintaining that illusion with new trays being brought out every so often.) I think their bread is a little softer, which I love, and it's just a plus that their prices are a tad lower (think 5-10 cents.) I've had mini and regular pineapple buns (the minis stuffed with bbq pork or stuffed with cream and strawberries), chicken buns, hot dog buns, egg tarts, milk tea... The flavor of the milk tea was a little different but it seemed strong to me. Fairly sweet as well. Anyway, I'm sure to keep coming back for their soft bread!
author: Delia Z.

description: I was skeptical that a Chinese bakery could compete with Sheng Kee a few steps away but Pineapple King lives up to its name and fills a boro-shaped gap in my heart/neighborhood. The boro you (pineapple bun with butter) here was way better than what I had in Taiwan, which was already ridiculously good. I'm telling you, there is nothing like a warm and sweet flaky boro bao paired with cold salted butter. It's a heavenly combination that I have yet to find elsewhere in the Bay Area. Granted, I still haven't had boro you in HK but I'd imagine they taste similarly! Overall, I like that Pineapple King isn't trying too hard by going all crazy and selling a million different kinds of pastries or drinks. Some of the breads here do look terrible but you want to come here for the boro--and for that, they're doing a splendid job.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Came here a month ago.
Got a bunch of buns and a meal.
They forgot my meal buns and only gave me a tea. I forgot to check because they put all the buns in a box. :( I was disappointed when my family was enjoying their buns while I looked for my hot-dog bun and small pineapple only to not see either of them.
The tea was really bitter, but that's okay. The cake was really good. Yummy fruit filling and almonds. My sister doesn't like Chinese cake but she even enjoyed it.
Overall it was okay. :( still sad over that hot dog bun.
author: MaryAnn H.

description:
First of all, I don't have too much experience with Chinese bakeries. I've only been to Sheng Kee and a former bakery on noriega street called lotus cafe. My favorite pastries are pork buns, and coconut buns.
This place is a small location that's open later than most places in the area. Btw, I went at 8pm and most other places were closed, but that's just how the sunset is I guess. I ordered a pork bun and a taro bun. I don't remember the price but it was very cheap, similar to sheng kees prices. The pork was pretty good, the taro bun was lacking (not enough taro).
I would go back here later at night, but I'd rather go to sheng kee cause they have a larger selection and more locations. Overall I'd Eat here, meh
author: Jim D.

description: Hidden gem of San Francisco..must have mango and chocolate mousse and strawberry and fruit cakes. As yummy as beautiful..
author: California G.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. Their pineapple bun was ok but I was definitely confused when I walked in. This place is extremely small. There are menus on the walls above the cash register area. You can also pick pastries up from the side onto a tray. (Trays are next to the register).

Pro:
-Pineapple custard buns are good and affordable!!!! ($1.50 for two)
-Other pastries were not bad.

Cons:
-Cashiers doesn't speak English. It was a bit hard to communicate. 
-Extremely slow service. I was the only one in the store before others started coming in but my 1 order of pineapple custard buns still took about 5 mins. 

I have high hopes for this place. If they were faster and got more experience, I think this place will do ok!
author: Mai W.

description: I feel a part of Hong Kong just landed in San Francisco.   The Pineapple King has the famous  pineapple bun with butter a warm pineapple bun and cold butter right in the middle of the bun. Right when you take your first bite you feel the richness of the melting butter with the warm and flaky bun.   It's not as good as the famous Tsui Wah cafe- Bo Law yau (pineapple bun with butter)  but still very satisfying when you get that craving to have a little bit of hong kong back in your life.
author: Belinda C.

description: The only thing to get here is the freshly baked and filled pineapple custard buns!!! Such a great price and so good! The buns are hot and crispy on the top! Eat it fresh but be careful the custard oozes everywhere. They're also good to take home and just microwave for a few seconds. My mom tried a lot of their other breads and pastries but they were all just mediocre, nothing special.
author: Linz C.

description:
Pineapple King takes over the Honeyberry spot. cheap baked goods. tea too.

baked items in plastic display cases like most  bakeries these days.
eats: peanut cookie (1)
-had some flavor, nice, s pieces
-taro bun
no taro flavor at all, just sweet & doughy
- apple turnover(1.2)
few cubes of canned apple
crust not  flakey

drips:
-sample of mango tea  (3.5)tasted very sweet
would skip.
-stuff cheap but low quality
-friendly, fast service.
author: Victor G.

description:
BOMB.com! I'm so glad that Irving St, is far enough from me that I wouldn't come here for a daily dose of Pineapple King! I tried out their ham and egg sandwich, regular pineapple bun, cocktail bun and Pineapple King with handmade custard. If you walk away with just one thing, make it the Pineapple King. It's served warm and the custard is ooey gooey deliciousness ready to burst in your mouth.

I docked one star off because they seem to be a little unorganized. The layout of the store is awkward and the gal working the register is a little slow. But I'm giving them the benefit of a doubt that this is likely because they just opened.
author: Tiffany U.

description: I had a good experience my first time here, so I decided to come back. The place is a little small, but people go in and out so it's not a big deal. I ordered the pineapple puffs because that's one of the popular items here. The last time I had it, I didn't eat it fresh so I didn't really enjoy it. This time I ate it right away and it was so good! I got egg tarts again because they were pretty good last time too. They didn't have chicken cookies, which I wanted but hopefully they'll have it next time I come. I've walked around a bit, but nothing really caught my eye. I'll look more carefully next time. The Thai tea and milk tea that they have out is so tempting, but I wish they made it fresh instead of having it sit there already. The place is pretty clean and the workers are pretty nice. I'd still be coming back
author: Maggie W.

description:
When Aziz Ansari (comedian/actor) flew out to Hong Kong on the show, "The Getaway", to eat Pineapple bun with a stick o' buttah, I was DYING!  DYING of laughter, DYING to eat one.  What he did wrong was peel the bun apart with his hands, which broke away all the crunchy cookie top.  The owner, Mrs. Chan gave him a mini lecture, he basically got in trouble!  I was rolling on the floor when he got scolded.  She took away his bun, then came back with a fresh one.  You are supposed to open your mouth and bite into the bun, that way, you get the crunchy top, fluffy warm bun and cold butter taste in one big bite. But most importantly, you will not waste any of the cookie top.  Learn from Aziz, don't peel the bun apart but instead, bite into it!

With that being said, I was excited to try this place and relive Aziz's adventure of eating a Pineapple bun.  Every pineapple bun order came out fresh and hot with a cold stick of butter. I was expecting my world to turn upside down with this bun! But guess what, even though I followed Mrs. Chan's advise of taking a big bite into the bun, it was not as wonderful as I was expecting.  Yes, it a warm fluffy bun.  Yes, it had a cold stick of butter that melts in your mouth. HOWEVER, the cookie top was not crunchy or thick enough, in fact, it was a tad too soft.  It's a shame that this tiny bakery didn't have any seating so you can get instant enjoyment to your bun.  I actually bought it and went to TeaWay to buy a boba tea to drink with this bun.  By the time I made it to TeaWay, the warmth of the bun cooled down a bit.  The experience might had been different if I could had eaten it in it's hot stage. 

I ended up buying 3 of these buns.  1 I ate at TeaWay, 1 was given away, and the last one I took home and ate the next day.  I put the last Pineapple bun into the toaster oven for less than 5 minutes and baked it back to it's glorious hot state.  Guess what?!  The cookie top was crunchy, the bun was warm and the butter had melted nicely into the bun and it tasted good!!  Much much better, in fact.  But if I had to compare this bun to other pineapple buns I've eaten in Chinatown, this one falls behind because the cookie top was not as delicious as others.  Wish I could call this the KING of Pineapple buns but I'm sorry to say, I can't give it it's crown.  I can give it 3 solid stars...
author: Jenny T.

description:
Credits go to the employee, at the counter, for being knowledgeable about her recommendations when their on-screen menus were not operating.  
This place is inexpensive as I can get 3 buns for $2.75.  Ordered the mini pineapple buns w/egg custard filling (菠蘿王 - 2 for $1.50) and a pineapple bun with a slab of slightly melted butter (菠蘿油).  I understand the pineapple bun with slightly melted butter is a HK thing, and perhaps it's just me being ABC, but I'm not fond of enjoying bread with butter that's not spread out; nonetheless, it is worth the try.  The mini pineapple buns, though, are tasty and worth the money.  They've been opened for 2 weeks so I'd give them another try when kinks are worked out.
author: Jessica S.

description:
wow I can't believe I'm saying this but pineapple bun with custard inside is bomb. I don't normally eat or try something decadent but dang. The bun is soft but crunchy from the crust

Thank god it's a mini size and just 2 for $1.50!

Will be back again but maybe try their order pastries
author: Carol Y.

description:
Amazing. I grew up eating a pineapple bun for breakfast basically everyday. Eventually I grew tired of it and so ended my pineapple bun obsession. I hated that most of the time, the top part of the bun would leave me with crumbs everywhere and I'd be dancing to shake it all off. 

NOW... Pineapple King Bakery has rekindled my love for these buns. Over the years I've had one every so often but it was more of a "I'm so hungry..." thing than a craving or want. 

They make these buns so moist and just flaky/crumbly enough. The fresh ones are to die for and even when left overnight they're still very soft and moist. I dropped by to grab one for breakfast for the next day and I got a pineapple bun with butter to eat on the spot.... I CAN'T DESCRIBE HOW HAPPY MY MOUTH AND TUMMY WERE. My fiance literally had to pry and guilt trip me for a bite. 

There isn't a large selection of goodies here and I haven't really tried anything except for the pineapple buns... There's also not much to say about service since there's not much to interact about. They're pretty quick at the cashier though. 

GO FOR THE PINEAPPLE BUNS!!!  That's what my stars are for.
author: Bonnie C.

description:
Wow, what a wonderful and surprising discovery!

My family and I were wondering around Irving and saw this little shop. Being the carb queens that we are, we had to check it out.

First off, the prices surprised us. It's very affordable and reasonable. I was so used to the pricey buns at all these other chain bakeries that it was refreshing to see the low prices here.

However, just because it's cheap, doesn't mean the quality was lacking. The buns were fresh and soft, and crumbly on top... just like how pineapple buns should be!

The warm custard filled bun is pretty good. It looks like they inject two of their small buns with a custard filling (think fresh doughnut style) and it's really tasty when it's warm.

I have a few concerns... I'm not a fan of the flow of traffic. When it gets busy (it doesn't take much to get crowded... the store is very small so if there are over 5 people in there) it can get chaotic. The trays are located in the middle of the shop, next to the cash register, so essentially the line to get trays will block the doorway. Also, you don't really get led to the other side of the bakery, so you have to cut through the long line to get to the other side. It causes confusion and delays the entire process, which creates frustration.

Also, I know they're new so I'll cut them some slack. The staff seemed panicky and helpless when it gets busy. When we ordered the custard filled buns, they asked us for a receipt. Ok... the only problem was, we didn't get one. Needless to say, that caused some major confusion. I think they need a better system (maybe of tickets or numbers) to keep track of the custard and butter bun orders.

Like I said, I'll cut them some slack so they can work out some of their kinks. They definitely have potential to be awesome because they have a great product and the prices are reasonable, so I'll definitely be back to try some more next time!
author: Sara K.

description: I highly recommend their pineapple bun with matcha green tea filling! It's 2 mini buns for $1.50. When I got it, we had to order it in line, they didn't bring it out - which meant that it was so fresh and warm! The custard one is also very creamy, but not overly sweet. I'd love to go back and try their other items.. and get more of the matcha filling!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Got their hot dog bun, taro pastry, and their egg pie.  I wasn't able to try the egg pie, but supposedly it was SUPER good!  The hot dog bun was fluffy and not chewy.  The taro pastry was flakey and had a moderate amount of taro filling.  Small place w/ great prices!
author: Ivy T.

description:
Pineapple King is an awesome new bakery that I will bring all my friends to! We popped in to see what they had and we tried their Pineapple bun straight from the oven. For those unfamiliar, there's no pineapple in this bun! It was delicious- we were in heaven. It's perfect for breakfast or a snack -- sweet but not too sweet. We got a few to take home. 
We also had their boba tea, which was fresh and tasted like it had real ingredients rather than just syrups and pre-mixed stuff. I recommend trying this as well. 
All in all, I'm kinda obsessed with this place and wish I lived next door because I want a Pineapple King right now!
author: Julie H.

description:
Delicious pineapple buns! They came in the butter variety as well a filling variety (cream or chocolate).

Get these and eat them on the spot! They are so crispy and yummy!  
These by far are the best I've had in the bay!

Parking is the biggest pain or I would come here more often.

Cash only but the prices are VERY reasonable.  Cute place, it would be nice if it were bigger for ppl to hang and take photos.  Then again...it is SF....
author: David W.

description:
3.5 stars.

Great pineapple buns...especially when fresh! I opted for the special - match cream pineapple bun and it was delicious. I can't wait to try the one with a pat of butter at a later date.

I'm docking off a star though for the rest of the pastries, which are mediocre at best. The custard cake was spongy but rather tasteless unfortunately. The location is quite small, so plan to grab-and-go!
author: Kate M.

description:
What I ate: Pineapple roll.
Visit date: March 8, 2015
First time? Yes.

I came in to peruse and breathe in the baked good aromas, and then I saw free samples of the pineapple roll. Um, yum! If they didn't have the samples out I would have walked out empty handed. Instead, I left with a few mini pineapple rolls. I went mini because they were a more appropriate bread dessert serving and because they were cuter than the normal sized rolls. 

The pineapple roll is just slightly sweet with a thin glaze of sweet on top. When you bite into the bread the bread practically melts in your mouth. It's soft and fluffy, and it's easy to inhale the whole roll. I gave one to my fiancé when I got home and I've never seen him eat a piece of bread that fast before. 

I'm not in the area a lot but I will definitely make another visit if I ever find myself near. In the meantime, you should go try their rolls for yourself!
author: Erin G.

description:
Called Pineapple King Bakery so must try their pineapple products. Reasonable prices.

Pineapple Puff:  2 for $1.50  Need to order at the counter and wait for the order.  Served warm with custard fillings inside. Just like a cream puff. Amazingly good. Be careful of making a mess.

Pineapple Bun with butter:  $1.25 Also need to order at the counter and wait.  It's good if you like the warm soft bun with butter. The cookie top on the bun is the best! I waited after a few mins drive and the butter melted completely. 

Red Bean filled pastry is flaky. Not too sweet which I like.

Would come back again.
author: Kei C.

description:
Yum! We woke up craving some pastries and headed here. It was a good sign when we saw a swarm of people inside. We got a green tea sponge cake, ham and egg bun, coconut bun, taro bun, BBQ pork bun, original pineapple bun and a milk tea for $10

The BBQ pork bun was right out of the oven so it was extra tasty! Generous meat portion too. 
The milk tea was surprisingly strong! 

I suggest reorganizing the pastries though like putting all the pineapple buns in one area (there's mini, custard, green tea custard, pineapple filling but was distributed throughout the store), savory buns in another and cookies and muffins in another area.

Parking was not too bad considering it was a Saturday morning.

Tip: cash only
author: Elaine L.

description: I've been to many Asian bakeries in my lifetime and Pineapple King is just okay. Kind of dry, not too flavorful. Had tried the butter cakes (both green tea and regular), a taro bun, and a pineapple and cream cheese bread. I did like the taro and pineapple and cream cheese but something was a little off (maybe too artificial tasting? candied pineapple? I don't know). Not my favorite place to go to but alright for some quick bites.
author: Natalie M.

description: I have tried their spam and egg sandwich a few times as a snack and quick breakfast. It's a great value. I don't think it is too unhealthy to have half an egg and a serving of spam. :) I enjoy this sort of bread that makes you kind of think you aren't eating as many carbs. I  also like the scallion bun and the curry beef bun. Everything is very cheap.
author: Regina C.

description:
Grand opening yesterday. That morning, I tried the ham and egg bun. The ham and eggs were pan fried and it smelled really good. All buns were warm and fluffy, freshly baked from the kitchen. Unlike Sheng Kee (on the same block)....their buns and bread are delivered from south san Francisco and then reheated. The cashiers were very polite. 
This morning, I wanted to get the curry beef bun (drool~) but I had to wait 10min for the next batch so I got the BBQ pork bun and ordered the pineapple puff (2 for $1.50). Everyone had a BBQ pork bun before. There's nothing new and exciting about it but when it's nice and warm and fluffy....Mmmmm....  I was hoping the pineapple puff would be something like Beard Papa's cream puff filling in a pineapple bun. (hahaha....) But it was really just Chinese style custard pineapple bun. Oh, ok. Still very yummy tho.
author: R C.

description:
I'm in love with the boloo....i got it for the low low....

yea this place is the best. get the custard and butter one each and eat them all so you can order some more then eat some more of that too.
author: Vince L.

description:
I'm in the car as I write this (in the passenger seat, of course!) and I just inhaled my Portuguese egg tart and Cha siu bao (bbq pork bun). 

The Portuguese egg tart crust was flakey, and the filling was the most creamy custard I have ever tried! 

The barbecue pork bun was out of this world. The bun was soft and buttery with ample bbq meat filling!
author: Mina K.

description:
WTF is this amazing goodness that is a pineapple bun sandwiching a cold slice of butter. I was suspicious at first but knew I had to try it and my only regret is that I got only one and had to share it with the BF. It's a must try!

I'm from out of town so I got almost one of everything to try and it is ALL good.
author: Cindy M.

description:
The smell in the store is amazing when you first enter...fresh warm asian breads and butter...what's not to love?

I've had a few different baked bread items (can't speak for any of the cakes/tarts) and have been all around pleased with the tastes and textures. From the pineapple buns to the savory green onion buns there is a nice balance of fluffy bread with just the right amount of crunch and crumble on the outside. If you get to have a warm bread fresh out of the oven...it's heavenly. :-) 

The prices are great too, though they don't take credit card (but most small places like this don't, so you can't really blame them.) 

Regular size pineapple bun is $0.80 and with butter it's $1.25. 

I still love Sheng Kee bakery but this is definitely going to be added to my solid list of Asian bakery options in SF that's just a little more specialized than the wide array offered at Sheng Kee.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Just another bakery that is trying to take business from Sheng Kee Bakery Cafe. Their prices are not anyway cheaper and quality about the same. Just a lot smaller store in a very busy intersection.
author: M C.

description: Called them 3 minutes before closing and asked them to stay open for me so I can drop by and pick up a last minute cake. Very accommodating. Door was already locked by the time I got there, but they still helped me out and even offered to write "happy birthday" on the cake rather than just rushing me out because they wanted to leave.
author: Tabitha W.

description:
Chicken cookies, what?

Seriously, I've never had anything like it. Doesn't happen often when I'm just out and about hunting for pineapple buns and you discover cookies that taste like chicken! But even if it's not everyone's cup of tea, the thought of it is pretty darn interesting.

As far as pineapple buns go, I like what these guys got goin' for them! They got the technique on point: the sugar must always cover the entire bun. No excuses! I picked up a dozen and they were extra tasty.

Are they really king? So far, all signs point to yes!

I need to come back again in the morning to try them fresh baked. Because there's nothing more disappointing than a day-old pineapple bun.
author: Anthony N.

description: TAKES CASH ONLY. Great prices for traditional and new Chinese pastries.  Came after dinner before closing so choices were more limited but still plenty to choose from.  Already had dinner but just had to get a Chinese chicken bun.  Prices were very affordable, bread on the bun bun was of good quality and the filling not too greasy.
author: Tj W.

description: New Chinese bakery in Sunset serving baked goods and bubble tea! The store was clean and brightly lit and definitely smaller than Sheng Kee, another nearby bakery. This also meant less choices but I have to say what they did have was delicious. I got a hot dog bun and custard bun, and the hot dog bun was much better than Sheng Kee's! The plump hot dog bits and a soft bread topped with some kind of kewpie mayonnaise and cheese mix were delicious and tasted like it was really made fresh. Since it's new, the cashier was pretty slow and couldn't remember the prices of stuff, but I'm definitely going to come back to this place!
author: Grace C.

description: Pineapple bun with butter is a definite must have. It is the closest I've found in the US to the HK pineapple buns with butter. The bun was soft and warm and the butter was creamy. I think when I come here again, I will try get there right when the pineapple buns come out of the oven (when I had mine it was warm but not hot anymore) and ask if they can do double butter.
author: Cynthia Y.

description:
**CASH ONLY**

Really fresh tasting bread. I got the pineapple bun, and it was really good however I thought there would be custard in it, which I didn't know til I left.. so when I found out I walked back in to get one with custard. The custard was good! Not too sweet, it was a good amount. I was debating whether to get the pineapple buns at this bakery or the one a few stores away but I liked this one because it was more simple and seemed more like a mom and pop shop. The people were really nice. My bf got the hot dog buns, they were pretty good as well, just not the best. I would definitely come here again if I was in the area.
author: Amanda B.

description: Went there one weekend,, there is no customer service, cashier only talked to the coworker, they dont care if the customer has questions.  I will not go back there again!!!! I  rather pay more to go to other bakeries, like paris baguette. They should go learn what customer service is !!!!!
author: Moon H.

description: Basically yelled in our faces "CASH ONLY!!!" when I whipped out my debit card to pay. Terrible attitude and seem to be in a pissy mood whenever handling customers; they don't even greet or make an effort to talk to you. Baked goods look OK but because of their rudeness I will NOT be coming back. Learn some social skills! And put up a sign warning customers of your "cash only" policy in plain sight.
author: Kaithlen P.

description: Best Pineapple bun w/ butter!  Made to order at only $1.25, say what?!?  Bun was soft and warm, crust was all around and crumbly & the big thick piece of butter - YUM!!
author: Gloria H.

description:
Definitely pineapple bread kings!

Ordered the pineapple buns with original and matcha filling.
author: Jimmy L.

description: This place is amazing. Simple, Delicious. They have best pineapple bun in state.  I can literally go to this place and easy walk out with a pink box of bread. Guaranteed that it would be finished within a day. Their "pineapple bun with butter" is the best and its taste is exact what I ate in Hong Kong. If you're ever in the area, this is winner.
author: Andre L.

description: Pineapple King Bao are average. They are not exceptional great or bad. This review is about their lack of common sense service. I bought 7 baos and the lady stuffed them Into a paper bag. I asked if she can place them into a pastry box to avoid them smashing and  instead her response was I was 1 bao short of "qualifying" to get a box. Yes, I could have paid for 1 more bao but I didn't feel that I had to. I understand if I bought 2 baos and asked for a box but 7 baos stuffed into a paper bag is stupid. Bad business practice. I will never return.
author: Ellen T.

description: Very good pineapple buns. There's many varieties: plain, custard, sesame filled, butter filled.
author: Sonny V.

description: This was my first time at P.K.B,and I found the customer  Sam service to quick and friendly,the items I ordered Fresh and delicious especially the Pineapple Bun with Butter ooh have mercy that was good.I would totally recommend visiting this place.Thumbs up and 5 stars.
author: Fred S.

description:
Delicious pineapple matcha puff! Make sure to eat them fresh, will try again

The lady is super nice too, if you don't know what to pick, just ask =)
author: Alex C.

description:
Randomly saw this place one night walking by and could not wait to come in during open business hours. As you can imagine, for someone who LOVES pineapples, I was very disappointed when I realized that there was barely anything in there that was actually pineapple flavor. Broke my spirit and excitement for that day. Very misleading name. 

However, I did not hesitate and tried like 10 other different things. 
My favorite on the list was the Half Moon Sponge Cakes (coffee flavored). Wold come back just for that one alone.
author: Maddie N.

description:
Best bo lo bao ever. My favorite place to go for it :)
Very affordable too! I highly suggest this place if you love pineapple bun
author: Sandy C.

description:
When it comes to Chinese bakeries, they don't compare to some of the ones I've tried in Hong Kong.  I still dream about the coconut bun at a bakery at the ferry dock.
So, there are a couple of buns I compare from bakery to bakery to see which ones I like better.  The coconut bun here is OK, not as much coconut as I'd like and I definitely like the ones at the Sheng Kee Bakery down the block better.
I didn't so much like the green onion/bacon bun here and don't really like it that much at Sheng Kee either.  My favorite bacon/onion bun is at the Sunset Bakery on 9th/Irving,
People seem to like the bun with a slice of butter.  I might make a return trip just to try one of them. It is a much smaller storefront than Sheng Kee and they have a more limited inventory.  When I was there a couple of weeks ago, it was cash only.
author: Ry T.

description:
If you are in need for a quick super cheap place to eat in the area look no further. I've been three times and am officially a fan. 

The pineapple bun with a cold slice of butter is fantastic but my favorite is their bun with custard filling. That or one of the breakfast buns runs you about $2 and is more than enough to fill me up. 

Good for a quick breakfast or snack, cash only but you literally only need $5 to fill you up.
author: Jethro P.

description: Ordered a BBQ pork pineapple bun and it was really really yummy. Probably one of the best pineapple bun I've had in the Bay Area and it was only 89 cents! Granted it a small bun...but packed full of BBQ pork and so worth it. Really want to come back and try the pineapple puffs you order at the cashier!
author: Bonnie S.

description:
This location is where the old Honeyberry store used to be (RIP Roti Buns, I miss you so much). And if you've been to Honeyberry, you know how small that storefront was. But it didn't stop me from squeezing in every corner to check out Pineapple King Bakery's pastries.

They have a wide variety of pastries - egg custard, cocktail buns, ham & egg rolls, pork buns, etc. They all look really fresh too, as I could tell when I pinched them with the tweezers to grab some of the pastries to put on my tray. 

It's cash only. But the prices are fairly cheap! I had a total of 6 items and I paid less than $5 for all 6 ($4.95 to be exact). I know most bakeries don't charge too much for their buns, but if I bought the same amount at Shengkee Bakery down the street, I probably would have paid close to $10.

Definitely coming back here whenever I'm in the area. I love the cocktail bun! The bread was so soft and the filling wasn't too sweet. Mmmm. Perfection.
author: Liezel D.

description: Matcha puff was nice and warm, tasted like custard bun. Highlight was chicken cookies. Otherwise, a typical HK bakery.
author: V L.

description: New Chinese bakery on Irving. I noticed this place when it was under construction. My mom brought home some pastries like beef curry bun and a lemon roll. I thought it was good.
author: Denise C.

description: It's your typical Asian bakery, serving up your usual choice of pastries: hot dog buns, custard tarts, sesame balls, pork sung buns and what not. The buns were nice and warm and the workers try hard to keep fresh buns coming out of the back.
author: Brandon N.

description: The most disgusting pineapple bun I've ever ate. Freshly made pineapple bun with a thick block of butter in the middle. Extremely gross. It's a perfectly baked pineapple bun gone wrong. They put wayyyy too much butter in this thing. I would not recommend.
author: Baldwin W.

description: My favorite pineapple buns in San Francisco!  Not only are they decent sized and well-priced, but they have that awesome moist chewy texture that a lot of places fail to make. Pineapple King is a little cramped - it's a small place that you pop in and out of - but it's FULL of pineapple bun options. Regular, mini, taro filled (favorite!), sesame, red bean, pineapple and custard. The lotus bun is also really good.
author: Michelle Y.

description: The best pineapple bun and cocktail bun I've tried yet! And I've tried several. Come if you need a good snack or comfort food.
author: Kimberly C.

description: I just ordered a quarter sheet cake from pineapple king for son's 6th birthday.  I love their cakes and buns but this cake was a disappointment!! You will know what I mean if you see the picture! I did made some changes on the colors but this cake look ugly period.  It didn't look professional at all..... I think I can do a better job on the cream!!
author: Chu Y.

description:
I walked by the other day and I decided to give them a shot strictly because of their name as "Pineapple King".  If you grew up in Asia like me, you should have heard of "Pineapple Bun with a thick slice of ice cold butter 菠蘿油".

Well, enough talk and let's cut into my review.  Pineapple bun is below average compared to other bakeries.  The crust on top of the bun was dry, not crunchy, and not sweet at all.  Moreover, their buns were a little chewy as well.  Something just wasn't quite right on their baked goodies.

Place is small, but clean and well organized.  Staffs are friendly.  However, they accept CASH ONLY, which is not quite convenient for some people.

Tip:
There are some better alternative bakeries if you walk further down the street.
author: Steve L.

description: This is my favorite bakery on Irving.  The girls behind the counter are always helpful and would warm up the buns if you ask them to.  The milk tea is decent as well.  If you catch them at the right time, the fresh out of the oven pineapple buns are soooooooooooooo good.
author: Katniss B.

description: Very good customer service. The cashier is a very good sales person. The pineapple bun with butter is very good but it's also very heavy. I like that they have mini pineapple buns. I will come back.
author: Melissa C.

description:
I was so excited to learn about this place before it was opened. Growing up in Hong Kong, pineapple buns are one of its delicacy that we grew up with so when I heard about this place, I was imagining how it would bring back a lot of childhood memories from my home place. This little shop is located in sunset so parking is not the easiest, but it was decent for a Sunday afternoon. I thought this place would serve more different types of pineapple bun, but it's really just another chinese bakery shop with maybe around 4 different types of pineapple bun (while I was there).

You would walk in, take a tray, wonder around the 3 display cases filled with bakery goods and choose whatever you like. You bring your tray over to the cashier counter when you're done to tally up your tab. Then they have their specialty, pineapple bun with custard or pineapple bun with butter that's listed on the menu where you have to order with the cashier (they also serve hong kong style milk tea, but my friend said it's not great). I ordered one of their pineapple bun with butter for $1.25 each. When it came out, the cashier told me to eat it while it's still hot. I grabbed it and it wasn't hot at all, it was luke warm, but not hot enough to melt that slice of butter they have wedge between the bun. It wasn't too bad, nor it brought me back to HK singing on top of the hills. It's soft bread with the crunchy top custard is decent, but the ones in HK just melts in your mouth, this one didn't do that. To sum it up, I think this is just another bakery with a little bit more pineapple bun to choose from.

Will I visit again? I don't know, maybe if I'm in the area....
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I'm a sucker for breakfast pastries, especially asian baos, so I needed to give this place a try!

I came here one morning as soon as they opened, and oh my goodness, the shop smelled great! All the baos were fresh out of the oven, and trying not to drool right then and there was one of the most difficult things I have ever done!

I ordered a few pineapple buns, one with a custard filling, one with a taro filling, and one with a red bean filling. The baos were a little flat and no where near as puffy as other ones that I've had fresh. I personally did not like the filling to bao ratio. The baos were a little doughy for my liking. I thought the baos could have used a little more filling to better balance the baos. My favorite of the three was the red bean. The level of sweetness was perfect, and the red bean was really flavorful. The taro was good, but a bit too sweet for me. The custard was okay, but you could definitely find a better custard filled bao somewhere else.

I also ordered a coffee bun and egg tarts. I didn't get a chance to try the coffee bun, but my friend said it was really good, and that it tasted even better than the pineapple buns. I was not expecting much from the egg tarts, but the tart was surprisingly flaky. However, there was way too much sugar in the custard, which made it taste a little off.

I plan on coming back soon to try the pineapple ice cream bun and the pineapple puffs!
author: Vivian L.

description:
This new bakery opened up very recently to take over what used to be Honeyberry, and I'm glad it did! It's set up just like any other Asian bakery with the self-serving from the display cases. Although the space itself is very small, they do know how to bake! The custard bun and dried pork rolls are my favorite so far, but the pineapple taro and regular pineapple buns are pretty good too. I think everything is under $2, and I personally think it's much better than the Sheng Kee chains.
Unfortunately, their selection varies quite a bit day-to-day (or I guess you can see that as a fun positive) so you can't come back with the guarantee they'll have what you want that time/day. Apparently one of the other reviewers claim that you can put in a request though and they'd have em ready for ya! I have yet to test this.
author: Andrew T.

description: This is just a 'pineapple oil' wanna be. If you had tried Liddo's pineapple oil in Richmond, BC, Canada, you would say it's no competition at all. The pineapple bun here is not fluffy at all. Traditionally, the butter must be a slice of salted butter, but they just inserted a slice of regular butter.
author: J L.

description: Love this new start up bakery! Just opened a month ago and right across the street from tpumps. All the pastries are so cheap, for ex.  the pineapple bun for only 80 cents! The ladies are super kind and they provide samples too. All the pastries are made fresh every morning. They sell boba too, at around the same price as tpumps. Haven't tried it, but I guess we'll see how it competes with its competitor across the street.
author: Hannah C.

description:
Oh man...this place totally satisfied my bau craving! Not to mention my chinese birthday cake craving (strawberry shortcake slice). It had been a while since I had bau or anything chinese, so I was excited to walk around the neighborhood Saturday morning in search of some good bau. The price is right and the bau's are tasty. I especially liked the spam and egg bau....mmmm!

Can't wait to go back! :) The fiancé liked the baus, too!
author: V M.

description:
The pineapple bun here is super doughy and the crust is too loose for me. I much prefer the crust  from GGB and the pineapple buns at that one dim sum place on Geary that's always busy. I did not enjoy their products as much as I'd like but maybe others will.

Roti buns were better quality overall. So sad that they had to go :(

I recommend: 
* Pineapple bun with butter
* BBQ pork pineapple bun (kind of salty though)

People seem to really like the custard filled ones. They're alright. It seems that the custard is piped into the bun and not baked in. 

The space is awkward to move around and it's always really busy. As that old Chinese dude in the store says: "It's cheaper than Beard Papa." 

(Although they're not comparable!)
author: Margaret S.

description:
Pineapple bun w/custard filling - Nice crunch, soft bun and silky smooth custard. Made to order. 

HK Milk Tea - Not Good!  They used the right kind of tea to achieve the flavor, but their people are not trained to make a proper cup milk tea. It tasted astringent and not velvety smooth.
author: Samantha E.

description:
I'm a sucker for pineapple buns so I was thrilled to try this place. 

I just got the regular pineapple bun because I wasn't aware that you had to order the pineapple custard puffs at the registered until I left. Oh well (another reason to drop by another time). 

The buns I got were from a new tray so it was freshly made. It nailed my expectations of a stellar pineapple bun. The top part was crumbly and the bread itself was soft yet a little doughy, just how I like it! 

Definitely coming back to try the custard puffs.
author: Emily M.

description: They have Chicken Cookies, how many places can still make those things...5 stars for offering that....  Good alternative to Sheng Kee, mom and pop bakery that caters to HK peeps..  The pineapple bun is really good....
author: Good A.

description: The crack filled cocktail bun gets a 5-star rating. Bought it for 60 cents on a whim and went back for two more. No seating so plan on taking it with ya.
author: Heather M.

description: Such a small hole in the wall. Some of the best pastries inside!! Pineapple bun with butter was to die for!
author: Tia Marie M.

description: This is only for the pineapple custard bun. Warm it up in the microwave for 20 seconds. Super yummy! A bun of goodness!
author: Karen H.

description: an HK mimicker but not the same.  offers pineapple buns with butter, and some other pineapple bun contents inside like taro and sesame.  however sloppy baking and flavor of buns like bbq pork just ok
author: Rob C.

description: My impression of this place was pretty good after my first visit. However, my second visit was totally a disaster. So I ordered a cake by phone. It was the green tea cheesecake. I asked if they are able to replace the chocolate pieces with macaroons. They said SURRE they can. The lady on the phone also asked the other coworker if there will be an extra charge, she made sure if was a NO. So she confirmed with me that the cake will be 29$. So I came in today to pick up the cake, the cashier said it is impossible for the cake to be just 29$. Since you added macaroons your total will be 48$. Are you serious? Your coworker was the one who made the mistake though.
author: Annie W.

description: Ask for a warm pineapple bun at the counter. All of the other pastries I've tried have been passable to decent, but the pineapple bun is delicious. Don't forget to bring cash.
author: Tina W.

description:
Had the mini pineapple bun, pineapple pastry, and cocktail bun.   Reasonable prices. Super fresh. Loved the flaky pineapple pastry!   So delish!!

Cash only.
author: A L.

description:
01.16.16

Same block as sheng kee 
Lots of people inside even tho it's a small place - so has to check it out

Cashier was friendly and quick. 

Got a spam and egg bun and pineapple bun to try. 

The spam and egg bun was not bad. Only 1/2 of an egg inside tho. 

Pineapple buns were good.
author: Jay R.

description: This place is cheaper than Sheng Kee Bakery. Pineapple King Bakery's quality is not as good (compared to Sheng Kee). I thought the products I got lacked flavor. The egg tart was ok but it was nothing special. I don't know what the black specks in the half moon lemon sponge cake were but it made me wary about the freshness of the product. Also, I didn't like how some of the lemon cream in the sponge cake were dried and a little crusty at the edges. I think their customer service makes up for the quality.
author: Carmen L.

description:
Love their fresh make pineapple bum!

They are crispy outside and soft in side. I recommend you eat it right after you buy it, taste so good. Try that one with filling which is 2 for $1.50  , and the one with butter $ 1.25. 

Price is very reasonable, people over there are very friendly!  5 star, no doubt!
author: Sina X.

description: Best Mango Mouse Cake I have ever tasted. Got one for my mom's birthday and all the guests love it.
author: Carlos S.

description: New bakery in the Sunset District. Best pineapple bun I ever had, nice crunchy top. Must try the savory cake rolls and mango mousse cups. So yummyThey also serve Hong Kong Milk Tea and iced Boba drinks.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
the buns with custard filling are over the top! SO GOOD! In fact I have sampled a lot of the
different baked goods and have enjoyed them all. While the place is very small the staff
is very fast and very pleasant.
author: Peter F.

description: I got the Pineapple Taro bun, and it was pretty average.
author: Vivian W.

description: There may be little in life better than a freshly baked hot pineapple bun with a thick slab of butter from the Pineapple King. Seriously. From the crowd picking up trays filled with pastries (compared to the empty ShengKee next door), clearly the other stuff ain't too bad either.
author: Andy D.

description: Pineapple buns with butter are fantastic. If you ask, they will put a thinner slice of butter to help reduce the amount of guilt you feel while munching on it.
author: malhardes D.

description: I was very excited to see this place take over the old Honeyberry/Crave location. This location hasn't seen much luck for the last 3 iterations, however Pineapple King Bakery seems to have figured it out. Pineapple King is probably the next best thing after Sunset Bakery (my favorite place for pineapple buns) and is a huge improvement over Sheng Kee. Their baked goods have been fresh every time I've visited and they have a few offerings that I haven't seen at an asian bakery in SF before including winter melon cakes. The baked cakes in the fridge window seem to be so so, but what I would make sure to try here are the pineapple buns. I love how they also sell mini pineapple buns for anyone wanting just a small snack. Be sure to try the cream filled pineapple buns because they are a great treat! The floorplan is a little weird which makes it hard to navigate around the line to the cashier to gather up all the baked goods you want to try, but overall it's a small inconvenience. Service is friendly and tries to be quick. The bubble tea is a little sweet, but overall not bad. Boba is nice and chewy and seems to be fresh.
author: Alice H.

description: why did my cousin-in-law from Ohio introduce me to this place?!? lol!!! well i am glad she did, prices are so reasonable and the pineapple buns are delicious especially hot out of the oven! the pineapple bun with butter was too much for me but the one filled with custard is like the bomb dot com!
author: Rosa K.

description: Walking up Irving street hungry looking for some quick bites. Pineapple king caught my eye. You would not find any pineapples here though. Neither will u find anything Made with pineapples. It's a bakery with pineapple buns as the main pastry item. Again, not made with pineapple Grab the pineapple bun with butter. Eat it with an hour. Soft and buttery heaven .....I will come back for more
author: Lory M.

description: The pineapple bun, egg tart and chicken tail bun were great, however when you order the pineapple bun with butter that would take you to wait at least 15 minutes.
author: Willem L.

description: Ordered: Palmiers, cake roll, and a BBQ bun. Disappointed in all. Palmiers were not light, crispy and buttery at all. It was pretty heavy and stale tasting. I love cake rolls from asian bakeries because of sponginess and not being too sweet like most american bakeries. The cake roll here was so dry and dense. On to the BBQ buns it didn't have that sweet sticky gravy inside.
author: Julie C.

description: Didn't think any bakery shop can survive near Shengkee but it does. Love the hot dog bun, luncheon meat bun, coffee buns (actually crunchy out of the oven),and greentea spongecake (kids love it).  Will definitely try the butter melted pineapple buns since it looks nice and fresh!
author: Annie L.

description: Pineapple butter is kinda good. I came from Chinatown to sunset to buy pineapple butter but I later found out I ended up just a bun without the butter. I was mad
author: Judy Z.

description:
this place is a ways away from anywhere i'd consider my stomping grounds but so worth the trip.  i went there as a plus one and a pineapple bun virgin.  there was some trepidation as i generally loathe pineapple (don't judge, pineapple lovers) but i was delightfully surprised that "pineapple" of the name refers to its crown of sugary/buttery crust.  inside is pure, fluffy, moist deliciousness...a party in your mouth.

being a novice, i liked that everything was labelled and on display.  the prices were so amazing for sf (or for anywhere for that matter) that i wound up trying a lot of them (the pork bun is a perfect blend of savory and sweet) and took some home that were still great the next day. they're a perfect snack or light meal. i had one for breakfast with a cup of coffee...awesome.

the staff there were completely charming and helpful and were making everything fresh and they should collectively run for mayor, which added to the whole experience.  i'll definitely be back.
author: Jason Z.

description:
I walked in and asked for cocktail bun, the lady at the front said it's on the self serve display case, but she offered to check since she is not sure there's any left.  She put on the plastic gloves and open the case, I had to stopped her right before she grabbed the bao, "miss, you can't use those gloves to grab the bun since you used it to open the display case".  She paused and said, 'ok, you grab it yourself and handed me the bag'.  I don't mind the self serve, but I am done with this place.

1. Pineapple Custard/puff -- custard flavor is good but it is way too doughy.  You probably get 1 teaspoon of custard per bun, I mean, seriously?

2. Cocktail bun --dry and doughy

What makes a bun/bao good, the fillings.
author: SF F.

description: Adding pat of butter to my fav bun? Brilliant idea right? I am greeted with a friendly face and asked if it's my first time visiting. I shyly say yes and order my bun. The lady taking my order is super nice and hands me a fresh warm bao and tells me to eat it right away while it's warm. There is nothing like the first bite. Slightly crispy, the topping quickly turns into crumbs and forms a mustache on my upper lip. Then the butter hits you. Awesome.
author: chi l.

description: Not my kind of pastry, but they make it only after order.  Price is cheap so worth a try it's it fits your palette.
author: daphne w.

description: Nothing special about the pastry here. The cashier didn't even know what items I have on my tray and how much to charge.
author: Mike W.

description: This place is a good find.  I like the buns better than next door Sheng Kee.  The prices are better too.
author: Jennifer T.

description: The kids are immediately hooked with the pineapple bun with custard after trying it!  They have become one of our favorite breakfast options.  And We like the smaller size ones, perfect for small afternoon snack and for the kids!  One of the best places in SF (the other one is in Inner Richmond so finally has a good one in Sunset) for pineapple buns!
author: KK C.

description: Ive noticed pineapple king bakery while heading to bank of america so i decided to pop in and see what they offered. Im not an expert on pineapple buns but god dammmmmm their pineapple buns are delish!! And prolly best in town. I ordered the pineapple bun with butter and also the pineapple buns with custard.. Both were awesome. The milk tea is not too shabby too, i will definitely go back to try other goods.
author: Molly M m.
